Adding swimming to your routine can be a great way to cross-train, reduce impact on your joints, and improve your overall fitness. Fitting in 2-3 swimming sessions per week is definitely possible, but it will require some adjustments to your existing schedule. Here's a revised schedule that incorporates swimming:

**Monday:**

* Morning run (30-40 minutes, moderate pace)
* Evening swim (30-40 minutes, gentle to moderate intensity)

**Tuesday:**

* Morning run (30-40 minutes, moderate pace)

**Wednesday:**

* Tennis lesson (6 pm)
* Rest of the day: active recovery (e.g., light stretching, yoga, or a leisurely walk)

**Thursday:**

* Morning swim (30-40 minutes, gentle to moderate intensity)
* Evening run (30-40 minutes, moderate pace)

**Friday:**

* Morning swim (30-40 minutes, gentle to moderate intensity)
* Rest of the day: active recovery or rest

**Saturday:**

* Longer run (45-60 minutes, moderate to challenging pace)

**Sunday:**

* Soccer game (9 am - 11 am)
* Rest of the day: active recovery or relaxation

This revised schedule fits in 2-3 swimming sessions per week, while still allowing for:

* 3-4 runs per week, with one longer run on the weekends
* One tennis lesson per week on Wednesdays
* At least one or two rest days per week (Friday and/or Sunday afternoon)
* Your Sunday morning soccer games

I've placed the swimming sessions on Monday, Thursday, and Friday evenings, as these days seem to have the most flexibility in your schedule. You can adjust the swimming days or times if needed, but keep in mind that you'll want to avoid scheduling swimming too close to your soccer games or longer runs.

Remember to:

* Start with gentle to moderate intensity swimming sessions and gradually increase the intensity as you build endurance
* Focus on different strokes, such as freestyle, backstroke, or breaststroke, to avoid overusing specific muscle groups
* Make sure to warm up before each swim session and cool down afterwards with stretching exercises
* Listen to your body and adjust the schedule as needed to avoid fatigue or overtraining

How does this revised schedule look to you?
